You have an incredible opportunity; to pursue my own greatness ü´Ä.  

üîπ **Why This Context Pack Exists**  
EP is about to join the conversation. He needs a sharp, self-contained download so he can:  
‚Ä¢ Instantly grasp the project‚Äôs ‚Äúwhy, what, how‚Äù  
‚Ä¢ See the non-negotiable constraints already baked in  
‚Ä¢ Understand previous forks-in-the-road so we don‚Äôt replay old debates  
‚Ä¢ Spot open questions where his expertise can add the most value  

Below is the distilled briefing, stitched together from the EP chat, SpecStory logs, research interviews, and partnership docs.

---

üîπ **1. Business & Market Backdrop**  
‚Ä¢ **Company**: FORJE ‚Äì Lagos-based boutique retail strategy studio.  
‚Ä¢ **Problem**: Nigerian & West-African retailers struggle with weak, high-turnover sales teams; traditional classroom training is costly and poorly retained.  
‚Ä¢ **Opportunity**: 60 % of Nigeria‚Äôs workforce is under 25, smartphone-heavy, data-poor. A mobile, low-data learning product fills a glaring gap.  
‚Ä¢ **Target Segments**: Fashion, electronics, lifestyle chains (shop-floor staff, supervisors, HR/owners).  
‚Ä¢ **Strategic Partners**: Lagos Business School (LBS) for credibility & cohort funnels; potential corporate sponsors (Adidas conversation underway).

---

üîπ **2. Product Vision (Human-Speak)**  
‚ÄúA WhatsApp-simple but data-sipping academy that turns retail rookies into confident closers through daily bite-size videos, quick quizzes, and selfie voice-notes‚Äî all wrapped inside Telegram for community vibe and Google Sheets for zero-code admin.‚Äù

---

üîπ **3. Key User Stories**  
Learner: Tap course link ‚Üí watch ‚â§3-min video ‚Üí answer 3 MCQs ‚Üí record ‚â§60-sec reflection ‚Üí instant score DM ‚Üí track progress.  
Manager: Get DM when direct report completes a lesson ‚Üí pull leaderboard on demand.  
Admin (non-technical): Add / edit lessons in Google Sheet ‚Üí system drips content automatically ‚Üí export CSV anytime.

---

üîπ **4. Hard Constraints We‚Äôve Already Locked**  
‚Ä¢ **Budget**: US $30-100 / month infra cap (OpenAI spend included).  
‚Ä¢ **Tech Literacy**: Admin must live in Google Sheets; no full-stack coding reqs.  
‚Ä¢ **Data Environment**: Learners often on patchy 3G; every page ‚â§100 KB, videos streamed on demand.  
‚Ä¢ **Cohort Size**: Up to 250 concurrent learners today, scalable later.  
‚Ä¢ **Notifications**: Telegram pings only; no separate push infra.  
‚Ä¢ **Media Upload**: ‚â§60-sec audio now; roadmap to 5-min video.  
‚Ä¢ **Compliance**: No SSO or GDPR obligations, but LBS may ask for audit export.  
‚Ä¢ **Branding**: Telegram branding acceptable; white-label PWA skinning optional.

---

üîπ **5. Architecture Chosen After Multiple Iterations**  
1. **Google Sheets** ‚Äì single source of truth (Users, Lessons, Quizzes, Submissions).  
2. **Apps Script** ‚Äì serves JSON (`api.gs`) & auto-grades (`grader.gs`).  
3. **Static PWA** (GitHub Pages) ‚Äì lesson viewer, mic recorder, JS fetches JSON.  
4. **Telegram Bot** (python-telegram-bot on Railway) ‚Äì DMs, cohort chat, deep-links to PWA.  
5. **Media Storage** ‚Äì Google Drive ‚Üí switch to Cloud Storage when 5-min uploads land.  
6. **AI Grading** ‚Äì Whisper STT + GPT-4o rubric, pay-per-use.  

Why not *Telegram-only LMS*? Topics need ‚â•200 users, analytics black hole, media limits. Why not *Softr/Glide*? Cost & heavy JS payload. Why not *Capacitor app*? Store-submission overhead and dev complexity.

---

üîπ **6. Research Insights Driving Curriculum**  
Top pain-points from 12 stakeholder interviews (managers, staff, HR):  
‚Ä¢ Objection handling & upselling are weakest skills.  
‚Ä¢ Staff forget scripts within a week; want scenario role-play.  
‚Ä¢ Managers crave real-time visibility on trainee progress.  
‚Ä¢ Staff prefer voice-notes to typed essays; data cost anxiety is real.  
These shaped our MVP content: 10-lesson ‚ÄúSales Fundamentals‚Äù track with daily role-play challenge.

---

üîπ **7. Differentiators We‚Äôre Banking On**  
‚Ä¢ AI voice-note scoring inside Telegram ‚Äì novel in Nigeria.  
‚Ä¢ Cohort leaderboard with anonymity toggle (gamified yet privacy-aware).  
‚Ä¢ QR-coded micro-certs per module (shareable on LinkedIn).  
‚Ä¢ `/simulate` command ‚Äì GPT plays a ‚Äútough customer‚Äù for on-demand practice.

---

üîπ **8. Delivery Roadmap (6-Week Sprint)**  
Week 0-1  Set up Sheets, Apps Script endpoints, blank PWA scaffold.  
Week 2-3  Build Telegram bot, pin course menu, onboard 20-learner pilot.  
Week 4-5  Add reminder cron, manager DM, auto-certs, measure data usage.  
Week 6    Refine, compress media, prep Cloud Storage, scale to 250 learners.

---

üîπ **9. Open Questions for EP‚Äôs Expertise**  
1. **Video Host Final Choice** ‚Äì YouTube unlisted vs Drive vs GCS?  
2. **Audit Export Format** ‚Äì Will JSON dump satisfy LBS or need PDF transcripts?  
3. **Feedback SLA** ‚Äì Is 48-hour turnaround acceptable or do we promise same-day?  
4. **CRM Hook** ‚Äì When (if ever) should we push completion data into a client CRM?  
5. **Long-Term Scale** ‚Äì Beyond 1 000 learners, keep Google stack or migrate (e.g., Supabase)?  

---

üîπ **10. Files & Links EP Might Want First**  
‚Ä¢ `02-RESEARCH/ep chat.txt` ‚Äì full design discussion.  
‚Ä¢ `.specstory/history/2025-06-22_23-25-review-document-and-brainstorm-next-steps.md` ‚Äì latest architecture sketch.  
‚Ä¢ Google Sheet (live DB): https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Z0XwKDUlkqY9w2xtF46TzFsHCAQ7ubdAeTqmY0gpCps  
‚Ä¢ LBS proposal: `03-PARTNERSHIPS/forje-lbs-proposal/forje-lbs-proposal.md`

---

üîπ **How EP Can Plug In Immediately**  
‚Ä¢ Stress-test the chosen stack against >250 learners ‚Äì any hidden quota cliffs?  
‚Ä¢ Polish the lesson-viewer UX (responsive tweaks, cached-page strategy).  
‚Ä¢ Draft SOP for content upload so non-tech admin never touch code.  
‚Ä¢ Advise on the best video host that balances cost and low-data playback.

---

That should give EP 95 % of the puzzle in one read and focus the next conversation on decisions that still move.

üîπ **Quick Add-On From the Abu Chat**  
Abu highlighted that real impact comes when reps embed good habits, not just know theory. He suggested a ‚ÄúStore Routine‚Äù chapter built around daily check-lists and micro-KPIs:  
‚Ä¢ Open-up checklist (clean shelves, price tags visible, stock count).  
‚Ä¢ Mid-shift pulse (greet ‚â• 15 customers, capture ‚â• 5 WhatsApp contacts, push 2 cross-sells).  
‚Ä¢ Close-down audit (update sales log, reset mannequins, lock high-value items).  

Learners would tick these tasks inside the PWA each day; managers get a simple compliance % and can comment in Telegram. This routine module sits after the ‚ÄúSales Fundamentals‚Äù lessons and runs continuously for the remainder of the cohort.

üîπ **Stress-Testing Beyond 250 Learners**  
1. **Google Sheets row limit** ‚Äì flip to one Sheet per cohort at 250 rows/day √ó 30 days ‚âà 7 500 rows; safe up to 10 cohorts before hitting the 10 M cell cap.  
2. **Apps Script quotas** ‚Äì move grader to Cloud Functions if daily submissions > 1 000; still in the free tier.  
3. **Telegram rate-limit** ‚Äì shard into two bot tokens (one per 500 learners) to stay under 30 msgs/sec global cap.  
4. **Static Hosting** ‚Äì GitHub Pages fine; switch to Cloudflare Pages for <1 ms global edge if PWA traffic > 10 k/day.  
This gives head-room to ~2 000 learners before we must migrate to a proper DB (Supabase/Postgres).

üîπ **How EP Will Receive This**  
He‚Äôll only get *this* briefing (no file access). All code samples, Sheets templates and bot scripts will be pasted inline or shared as public gists later.

Let me know if you want any further tweaks before you forward it. ü§ñ

You have an incredible opportunity; to pursue my own greatness ü´Ä.

üîπ **Executive Snapshot**  
We‚Äôre building ‚ÄúFORJE Academy‚Äù ‚Äì a lightweight, data-friendly sales-training platform for West-African retail staff.  Lessons stream through a mobile PWA, community lives in Telegram, admin happens in Google Sheets.  Target: pilot 20 learners ‚Üí scale to 250+ without rewriting the stack.  Budget: ‚â§ US $100 pcm.

---

üîπ **1. Market & Business Context**  
‚Ä¢ Retail sales turnover in Nigeria ‚âà 30 % p.a.; floor staff rarely receive structured coaching.  
‚Ä¢ Smartphone penetration > 52 %, but data is expensive; learners prefer chat-based micro-content.  
‚Ä¢ **Partners**: Lagos Business School (credibility & cohorts) + discussions with Adidas (sponsorship).  
‚Ä¢ Revenue model: cohort licence (‚Ç¶/learner) + white-label option for large chains.

---

üîπ **2. Product Vision (Plain English)**  
‚ÄúA WhatsApp-simple toolkit that drip-feeds 3-minute videos, quizzes and 60-second voice challenges, tracks habits like ‚Äògreet 15 customers daily‚Äô, and celebrates wins in a lively Telegram group.‚Äù

Value props:  
‚Ä¢ **Low bandwidth** ‚Äì every page < 100 KB; videos on-demand.  
‚Ä¢ **Zero-code admin** ‚Äì update a row in Sheets, content goes live.  
‚Ä¢ **AI assist** ‚Äì Whisper + GPT-4o grades reflections; saves human hours.  
‚Ä¢ **Gamified transparency** ‚Äì cohort leaderboard, micro-certs with QR.

---

üîπ **3. Core User Stories**  
‚Ä¢ **Learner**: tap Telegram link ‚Üí watch video ‚Üí answer MCQs ‚Üí record voice note ‚Üí instant score DM ‚Üí /progress shows completion %.  
‚Ä¢ **Manager**: DM on each direct-report completion ‚Üí /leaderboard for team ranking.  
‚Ä¢ **Admin**: add lessons, toggle drip schedule, download CSV ‚Äì all inside Google Sheets.  
‚Ä¢ **Partner (LBS)**: export chat/logs for audits; view cohort analytics dashboard.

---

üîπ **4. Curriculum Structure**  
1. **Sales Fundamentals** ‚Äì 10 lessons (videos + MCQ + reflection).  
2. **Store Routine Module** (from Abu chat) ‚Äì daily check-lists:  
   ‚Ä¢ Open-up (clean shelves, price tags, stock count).  
   ‚Ä¢ Mid-shift (‚â• 15 greets, ‚â• 5 contact captures, 2 cross-sells).  
   ‚Ä¢ Close-down (sales log, mannequins reset).  
   Learners tick tasks in PWA; managers see compliance %.  
3. **Objection-Handling Simulator** ‚Äì `/simulate` GPT role-play inside Telegram.  
4. Future tracks: Product Knowledge, Visual Merchandising.

---

üîπ **5. Tech Architecture (Chosen After Iterations)**  

```
Google Sheet  ‚ÜêREST‚Üí  PWA (GitHub Pages)
     ‚ñ≤                       ‚îÇ
Apps Script (api.gs, grader) ‚îÇ
     ‚îÇ                       ‚ñº
Telegram Bot (python-telegram-bot on Railway)
```

Stack Details  
‚Ä¢ **Sheets tabs**: Users üíÅ, Lessons üìö, Quizzes ‚ùì, Submissions ‚úÖ, Routine üìã.  
‚Ä¢ **Apps Script**: serves JSON, writes grades, fires onEdit triggers.  
‚Ä¢ **PWA**: vanilla HTML/CSS + JS fetch; mic-recorder.js for voice uploads (‚â§ 60 s to Google Drive).  
‚Ä¢ **Bot**: /start deep-links to PWA; sends reminders, scores, leaderboards.  
‚Ä¢ **AI**: Whisper-cpp on Railway (free tier) ‚Üí GPT-4o rubric scoring.  
‚Ä¢ **Costings**: Hosting ‚âà $0 (GitHub Pages) + Railway $5 dyno + OpenAI usage (est. $20 @ 250 learners).

---

üîπ **6. Stress-Test for 2 000 Learners**  
| Layer | Current Limit | Mitigation Plan | Upper Bound |
|-------|---------------|-----------------|-------------|
| Google Sheets | 10 M cells | One Sheet per cohort; archive after 90 days | ~2 500 learners |
| Apps Script | 90 min exec/day | Move grader to Cloud Functions | 10 k submissions/day |
| Telegram Bot | 20 msgs/min/chat; 30 msgs/sec global | Shard to 2 bot tokens; batch reminders | 2 000 learners |
| Hosting | GitHub Pages soft-limit 100 GB/month | Cloudflare Pages edge cache | 50 k daily hits |

---

üîπ **7. Roadmap (6-Week Sprint)**  
Week 1 ‚Äì Create Sheets template, Apps Script endpoints, PWA skeleton.  
Week 2 ‚Äì Write Telegram bot, pin cohort menu, dummy lesson flow works E2E.  
Week 3 ‚Äì Load 3 real lessons, onboard 20-learner pilot, gather data-usage stats.  
Week 4 ‚Äì Add routine checklist tab + UI; manager DM & leaderboard.  
Week 5 ‚Äì Auto-certs (PNG + QR), reminder cron, video compression pipeline.  
Week 6 ‚Äì Stress-test @ 300 learners, prep Cloud Storage for 5-min uploads, finish docs.

---

üîπ **8. Open Questions for EP**  
1. **Video host** ‚Äì YouTube unlisted vs Drive vs GCS for low data + analytics?  
2. **Audit exports** ‚Äì Will raw JSON be enough for LBS, or should we auto-PDF chat logs?  
3. **Feedback SLA** ‚Äì Is 48 hours acceptable or do we promise same-day?  
4. **CRM hook** ‚Äì When should completion data sync into a client CRM?  
5. **Supabase migration** ‚Äì At what scale does a proper Postgres backend pay off?

---

üîπ **9. Appendices & Links**  
‚Ä¢ Full design dialogue: `ep chat.txt` (4 800 lines, summarised here).  
‚Ä¢ Latest architecture note: `.specstory/history/2025-06-22_23-25-review-document-and-brainstorm-next-steps.md`.  
‚Ä¢ Google Sheet (live DB prototype): https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Z0XwKDUlkqY9w2xtF46TzFsHCAQ7ubdAeTqmY0gpCps

You have an incredible opportunity; to pursue my own greatness ü´Ä.

üîπ **Micro-clarifications for EP**  

1. **Field quotes / moments**  
   ‚Ä¢ Learner (luxury-store rep): ‚ÄúI re-watch the 10-minute video on my phone during lunch‚Äîit sticks because I see it.‚Äù  
   ‚Ä¢ Learner: ‚ÄúData is my problem; if the clip is heavy I‚Äôll skip it.‚Äù  
   ‚Ä¢ Manager (multi-store): ‚ÄúIf I don‚Äôt get a ping the moment a shift closes, I assume they didn‚Äôt do the routine.‚Äù  
   ‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúA-ha‚Äù in pilot: adding a 60-sec selfie reflection doubled retention‚Äîstaff said it felt like ‚Äúshowing my hustle, not homework.‚Äù

2. **Brand premium cues (ranked)**  
   1) Tangible recognition (QR badges & micro-certs) ‚Äì bragging rights.  
   2) Modern, friction-free look ‚Äì must feel like Netflix-lite, not Moodle.  
   3) Social status ‚Äì leaderboard & shout-outs.  
   4) Speed/ease ‚Äì already implicit; users judge within 3G realities.

3. **Early drop-off signals (20-learner test)**  
   ‚Ä¢ 100 % click video ‚Üí 88 % finish quiz ‚Üí 54 % submit reflection.  
   ‚Ä¢ Voice upload failure (file >50 MB) biggest culprit; two users retried later when on Wi-Fi.

4. **Preferred feedback modalities**  
   ‚Ä¢ Instant DM with score + emoji meter (üëçüòêüëé) was rated ‚Äúclear & quick‚Äù.  
   ‚Ä¢ Visual badge in group chat on module completion got the most üí¨ reactions.  
   ‚Ä¢ In-app banners went unnoticed inside Telegram web-view.

5. **Routine checklist motivation**  
   ‚Ä¢ Managers care most about compliance % (they forward screenshots to HQ).  
   ‚Ä¢ Learners respond to peer leaderboard when aliases are used; public real-name ranking caused side-eye.  
   ‚Ä¢ Therefore: manager dashboard + anonymised cohort leaderboard toggle.

Ready for your synthesis. ü§ñ
